channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Chasing yield’ was an inside joke at SVB—until it led to the bank’s collapse
item.description: Back in 2011, some of the bank leaders were involved in running jokes about chasing yield—now they don't seem so funny.

item.title: What Trump’s Hatred Taught Me
item.description: When the former president attacks immigrants, this is what I hear.

item.title: Jokes and Offbeat Auctions for the Troops: Standup Comedy Sweeps Ukraine
item.description: Even as the conflict with Russia grinds on, a new generation of comics in Ukraine is trying to make people laugh — and raise money for the war effort.

item.title: Ladakh’s Local Hero Wants India to Pay Attention to His People
item.description: The activist Sonam Wangchuk is leading protests to demand more autonomy for India’s remote Ladakh region, which shares borders with China and Pakistan...

item.title: Elon Musk’s chances against OpenAI look grim as ChatGPT creator moves to dismiss second lawsuit
item.description: Accusing OpenAI of everything from fraud and racketeering to false advertising and unjust enrichment may look like the legal equivalent of throwing sp...

item.title: Russian Strikes on Ukrainian Ports Target Civilian Shipping
item.description: With the strikes in the Odesa region, Russia appears to be trying again to prevent Ukraine from exporting grain, harming its economy and pushing up wo...

item.title: ECB is set to deepen global easing with rate cut it didn’t expect
item.description: The third quarter-point reduction of this cycle is seen likely by economists to herald a longer-lasting acceleration in cuts.

item.title: Silvio Berlusconi Died. But for Her, the ‘Bunga Bunga’ Scandal Lives On.
item.description: The woman at the center of revelations of bacchanals at the former Italian prime minister’s villa is still fighting a court case, and a negative publi...

item.title: Russian Strikes on Ukrainian Ports Target Civilian Shipping
item.description: With the strikes in the Odesa region, Russia appears to be trying again to prevent Ukraine from exporting grain, harming its economy and pushing up wo...

item.title: India is now Russia’s No. 2 supplier of restricted technology
item.description: The most recent data means almost a fifth of the sensitive technology that goes into Russia’s military-industrial complex got there via India.

item.title: Trump Hits Coachella, Campaigning Once Again in a Blue State
item.description: The former president took a detour from the battleground states to hold a rally in the California desert, where temperatures hovered near 100 degrees.

item.title: Race season is here: here are the costs (literally and mentally) that go into being a long-distance runner
item.description: From trainers, vests, watches headphones, race places and more, running isn’t as cheap as you may think—not to mention the time and emotional costs.

item.title: Ladakh’s Local Hero Wants India to Pay Attention to His People
item.description: The activist Sonam Wangchuk is leading protests to demand more autonomy for India’s remote Ladakh region, which shares borders with China and Pakistan...

item.title: Can the Government Get People to Have More Babies?
item.description: Japan has been trying to boost its fertility rate for 30 years. Now the rest of the rich world is, too.
